se.jguru.nazgul.test.messaging

Class AbstractJmsTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.jguru.nazgul.test.messaging.AbstractJmsTest
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractActiveMqTest, AbstractHornetQTest, AbstractRequestResponseJmsTest

    public abstract class AbstractJmsTest
extends Object
    Abstract superclass for JMS-related tests, wrapping a MessageBroker to which all calls are delegated.
    Author:
    Lennart Jörelid, jGuru Europe AB

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected MessageBroker broker 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected AbstractJmsTest(boolean transactedOperation, MessageBroker broker)
      Creates a new AbstractJmsTest instance, returning transacted JMS objects by default as indicated by the supplied parameter.

      MessageBroker getBroker() 
      boolean isTransactedOperation() 
      abstract void setupServices()
      Implement this method to setup any Services (i.e. server-side listeners) that should be active and connected for the test.

      Starts the JMS BrokerService.

      Stops the JMS BrokerService.

      Implement this method to tear down any Services that have been active and connected during the test.

    • Field Detail

      • broker

        protected MessageBroker broker

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractJmsTest

        protected AbstractJmsTest(boolean transactedOperation,
                          MessageBroker broker)
        Creates a new AbstractJmsTest instance, returning transacted JMS objects by default as indicated by the supplied parameter.
        Parameters:
        transactedOperation - if true, all retrieved sessions will be transacted by default.

    • Method Detail

      • isTransactedOperation

        public boolean isTransactedOperation()
        Returns:
        true to indicate that this AbstractActiveMQTest is configured to run in transacted mode (i.e. that all JMS objects requested from this superclass are configured to use transactions).

      • startJmsBroker

        public final void startJmsBroker()
                          throws javax.jms.JMSException
        Starts the JMS BrokerService.
        Throws:
        javax.jms.JMSException - if any of the underlying JMS methods does.

      • stopJmsBroker

        public final void stopJmsBroker()
                         throws javax.jms.JMSException
        Stops the JMS BrokerService.
        Throws:
        javax.jms.JMSException - if any of the underlying JMS methods does.

      • createConnection

        protected javax.jms.Connection createConnection()
                                         throws javax.jms.JMSException
        Returns:
        a started JMS Connection to the Broker using the known connectionFactory.
        Throws:
        javax.jms.JMSException - if the connection could not be created or started.

      • createSession

        protected javax.jms.Session createSession(javax.jms.Connection connection)
                                   throws javax.jms.JMSException
        Creates a JMS session from the supplied connection, and using the value of the transactedOperation to determine the transaction state.
        Parameters:
        connection - The connection used to create a session.
        Returns:
        A JMS session from the supplied connection.
        Throws:
        javax.jms.JMSException - if the createSession operation failed.

      • createSession

        protected javax.jms.Session createSession(javax.jms.Connection connection,
                                          boolean transacted)
                                   throws javax.jms.JMSException
        Creates a JMS session from the supplied connection.
        Parameters:
        connection - The connection used to create a session.
        transacted - if true, the retrieved session is transacted.
        Returns:
        A JMS session from the supplied connection.
        Throws:
        javax.jms.JMSException - if the createSession operation failed.

      • afterStartJmsBroker

        protected void afterStartJmsBroker()
        Override this method to perform any normal setup after the Broker is launched. For example, any classes which should be registered with the broker should be instantiated here.

      • beforeStopJmsBroker

        protected void beforeStopJmsBroker()
        Override this method to perform any normal tear-down before the Broker is stopped. You might cleanup any instances which should be de-registered from the broker.

      • setupServices

        public abstract void setupServices()
                            throws javax.jms.JMSException
        Implement this method to setup any Services (i.e. server-side listeners) that should be active and connected for the test.
        Throws:
        javax.jms.JMSException - if the underlying operations throws a JMSException

      • tearDownServices

        public abstract void tearDownServices()
                               throws javax.jms.JMSException
        Implement this method to tear down any Services that have been active and connected during the test.
        Throws:
        javax.jms.JMSException - if the underlying operations throws a JMSException

      • getBroker

        public final MessageBroker getBroker()
        Returns:
        The wrapped MessageBroker instance.
